Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.packet

Class PacketReader

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.packet.PacketReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Reader<Packet>
public class PacketReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reader<Packet>
Reader used to read a Packet. For more informations, read Protocol.txt.

  • Method Details

    • process

      public Reader.ProcessStatus process​(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
      Processes the buffer and extracts a byte (the type of the packet). After that the process method will read different type and length of data depending in the type of the packet. This method remembers what has been processed beforehand. The returned value can be :
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.REFILL : if the reader has not finished.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE : if the message is ready to be get.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.ERROR :
        • If the type is not recognized. (i.e. not between 0 and Packet.PacketType.TOKEN (5))
        • If the type is Packet.PacketType.ERR and the code is not recognized. (i.e. not between 0 and Packet.ErrorCode.ERROR_RECOVER (5))
        • If any length read is not between 1 and ChatOSUtils.TEXT_SIZE.
      Specified by:
      process in interface Reader<Packet>
      Parameters:
      bb - the buffer where to read the data. Must be in write-mode before being called and will be kept in write-mode after.
      Returns:
      the current state of this reader.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if bb is null.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the reader has already finished reading data. (i.e. already returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE)

    • getFailure

      public PacketReader.ProcessFailure getFailure()
      Returns:
      the failure code.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the reader hasn't failed.

    • get

      public Packet get()
      Specified by:
      get in interface Reader<Packet>
      Returns:
      the packet if the process method has successfully read a packet.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the process method hasn't finished to read a packet.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the reader to its initial state.
      Note that the packet will not be accessible with get() until process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Reader<Packet>
